J0rgen,"2010-08-01T16:20:19.163Z","A lifelong dream comes true!","Since I was a kid I've dreamed of owning a Greek warrior, so when I saw Series 2 was going to contain a Spartan minifigure I was thrilled! capnrex,"2010-08-08T06:22:12.59Z","The Spartan","

The Parts - The pieces for this minifigure are sublime, Lego has evidently taken great care when designing all of the new pieces and new prints that put together create one of the greatest minifigures I think I own. We will start with the helmet which is lovely, it is a kind of a misted golden with the plume adorning the top of the helmet being red. The sculpting for this part is fantastic and is certainly in the same class as the Arealight Spartan helmets. I think that one of the nicest touches on this figure has got to be the tiny lines running along the plume giving a sense of it being made up of hundreds of tiny feathers like a real Spartan helmet would have been. The head is also very
column2: well done with an angry expression surrounded by a very dark beard. Next he has a dark red cape which is a nice addition, this cape is a slightly darker colour than the&nbsp
column4: The Wrestler from Series One which I did not expect. His torso is brilliant with a&nbsp
column6: designed breastplate marked with rivets and decorative patterns&nbsp
column8: grey spear, the head of which is a lighter grey than the pole it is placed on. I am very pleased they did not use the spear from many of the Castle or Kingdoms sets as this new spear just feels a little bit more realistic. The shield is quite simple. It is&nbsp
column9: circular with a handle at the back and a stud for attaching something at the front. This stud gves the possibilty of adding some sort of decoration onto the shield which would improve it further.&nbsp
column12: the shield and the colour for it is well chosen.&nbsp
column13: The legs are also excellent with a sort of red skirt printed on them. Better than that though is the detail on his feet of some shoes or sandals which contiues around the side.

column1: The Figure - This is certainly the best all round figure of the Series with great detail which puts it up there with the best for display, and excellent playability thanks to the weapons included. This figure could certainly be desired in multiples for either simply the wonderful parts or for the possibility of creating huge battles with these minifigures.
Overall -
column2: The figure as you can probably tell is in my opinion totally perfect and so obviously&nbsp
column3: it has a mark reflecting that, which is of course 10/10! If you want to only get one figure from this&nbsp

column1: Carl,"2010-12-25T20:00:21.59Z","Spartan Warrior","WOW! The Spartan Warrior is without a doubt one of the absolute BEST minifigs ever created by LEGO! He is my favourite of Series 2 and also Series 1 and 2 combined, and he is an incredible minifig. The only thing rated down is the playability, as he is only a minifig. His pieces are some of the best I have ever seen. His new spear, shield and helmet are incredible and LEGO has captured the Spartan spirit perfectly. Overall, the Spartan Warrior is a MUST HAVE for all LEGO fans, and I would definitely and whole-heartedly recommend him to everyone.",FALSE,5,5,5,3,5

Lego_Minifig_Man,"2010-10-10T22:51:58.347Z","For Sparta!!","

This is definetely one of my favourite minifigures! I got this for $2.99. I only bought this one from Series 2, and considered buying the vampire.
Accessories &
column2:
Helmet
This is the first set that features this helmet. It has a nice darker red color on the... brush part. And the rest is gold. He has a spear, which is new. It has a nice diamond shape on the tip. The tip and the rest of the spear are two different colors. The tip is gray, and the rest is dark gray/black. He has a -I think new- sheild. It's really cool, and has a stud peice on the front so you can attach some studs. The minifig has to have his hand turned horizontally, unless you want it to look like he's purposely holding it away from himself. He also has a nice cape! It didn't come in cardboard or anything like that, for people who feel the packages to identify the minifigure. It's a dark red color.
column3: It's nothing special, but who doesn't like capes? And like all the others, it comes with a standard stand. The stand is an 3x4 black flat peice but with only four studs on top.
column4:
Head
He has a black beard which is printed on the head, not a separate peice, and doesn't look too friendly! He has yellow skin, which is normal for a minifigure excluding ones from
column6: He has some eyebrows, and is clenching his teeth preparing for battle!
column7:
Torso
His torso is a nice brown color. The front has printed on gold armor. His arms are yellow/bare, and he has normal yellow hands.
column8:
Legs
His legs have a... well I don't want to make him sound too girly, but I'm gonna call it a skirt. The top peice is colored dark brown. The back part isn't printed, which isn't too surprising, but it kind of makes him look like his butt is showing. There's one big problem. Unless he is leaning forward a bit, the bottom part of the skirt is cut off from the top part, which looks very strange. He also has some lines or somthing on his feet. I'm not sure what it's supposed to be, because it's only printed on one side, and it's not at the bottom part of his foot. It may supposed to be sandals or shoes...??
column9:
Playability
This has lots of playability! I mean, c'mon! It's a gladiator! Also you can build an army of them, which would look great if you switched the heads!
column10:
Conclusion
I will miss the barcodes in Series 3, but oh well. I guess lego thinks they'll sell more- But for me that means I won't buy any. I gave it a low building experience because it was nothing special. And to be honest I'm not sure what they mean by that. If there was problems rate it low? Nothing special rate it low? Not problems rate it high? Anyways, this is a must-have minifig! Buy it now!

Johan_V_D_,"2011-02-21T05:31:19.653Z","a plea for a phalanx battle pack","Lego calls this range of minifigs in a bag ""Collectables"". While some of the figs in the collection I find a bit to dull, or of to poor quality to have the right to claim this title, there are some that stand out and realy deserve a spot in a showcase.
The Spartan being one of them.
Its merits are abundant:
  • *Its overall design and color selection
column2: seems somebody at Lego wanted to show off doing this
column3:
prove what can be done when designing a minifig.
  • *Nice printing overall
column4:
a great torso design (makes it even less understandable what happened with e.g. the surfer).. printed legs are good too, though with a minor fault.
  • *Very expressive face
  • *A very nice, accurate helmet, done in two colors
  • *a new, two colored spear
  • *and to complete it, he is equiped with a round shield and a red cape.

    • Are there no cons then? Of course there are
column5:
nobody is perfect, neither are minifigs. But the flaws are few:
  • *The printing of the legs could have been done a bit better, extending it higher and onto the back of the legs. Though this problem is partially covered by the cape.
  • *The shield has an interesting color, but looks a bit dull. Having it printed with some ancient greek style design would have made it perfect. (like it seems Lego will be doing for the upcomming Viking minifig).
  • *And most important, but not a con of the fig itself, rather of the concept: its availability. Its one of the figs least present in a box of this series, which already makes it sought by collectors. Add to this its reputation, and the fact that if you want to use it for something else then just showing, you 'll need several of them (because be honest, a one man phalanx isnt effective nor impressive..)... and you know that there is another ""Batman syndrome"" on its way on the secondary market.

This fig just begs for making a ""battle pack"" of them,
or... looking at my Atlantis temple which became its home, lets keep hoping for Lego to come up with an ancient Hellas or Rome theme..


",TRUE,4,4,2,4,4

column1:
IndyAJD,"2011-03-03T08:07:01.89Z","The best minifig of series 2!","

Okay.
column2: When I first saw this guy, I wanted him soooo badly, that I broke down and bought one on ebay. &nbsp

column1: JtheMonk,"2011-02-19T09:04:58.327Z","What's Not to Like?","Most people rate this as the best of the minifigures released to this point, with the only real competitor being the Elf from series 3. It's hard to argue with that
column2:
everything, from the unique two-tone helmet to the torso printing to the fierce expression on his face is pretty much perfect. For most people, if they bought 10 random packs of minifigures and came out with 8 or 9 Spartans, they wouldn't be all that upset, because the more Spartans you have, the cooler/more imposing they look as a group.

The only real complaint that could be voiced is that the printing on the legs doesn't go up quite far enough, so there's a thin yellow gap between the red leg connector and the leg printing, but that's a minor flaw at best, and one common to most of the collectible minifigures line.
",TRUE,5,5,3,5,4

column1:

TheFadedTBCap,"2011-04-03T16:42:54.357Z","One of the Best From Series 2!","

The Spartan is definitely a cool minifigure!
column2: He has awesome golden armor on his chest and a golden helmet.&nbsp
column3: The new spear he holds is great, it comes with a nice looking cape, and the shield matches well, but could use a design on it.

column1: Pros:
<ul>
• Cool golden armor painting on torso
• Comes with lots of accessories that include a cape, a spear, a golden helmet, and a shield
• Nice war face (sadly its kind of hidden by the helmet)
• Works great in a big battle and the accessories are great for any figure
Cons:
<ul>
• When you bend the leg joint, yellow skin is visible other than the burgundy colored shorts
Overall, this a great minifigure with awesome parts. I give it a 5/5!
column2:
I recommend you buy this set.

",TRUE,5,5,4,5,5

column1:
Shistavanen_brick,"2011-03-29T18:31:49.39Z","I want to take over THAT town.... ","

Figure.

This is THE one to get from series 2. Preferably a bunch of them! Even if LEGO doesn't have an Ancient theme going on (yet) this could easily be found in a museum or such, in a City themed town or city, displaying Ancient history. The parts are all very detailed and wonderfully sculpted. The figure itself looks stern and ready to battle anyone!
column2:
Loving the helmet and the spear. This could be a nice gift for your history geek friend, once you have supplied your OWN need for Spartans first. Haha!

Pros.

  • The figure as a whole.
  • Equipment and weapons.
  • Very display friendly!

Cons.

  • As with most collectables: the price.
",TRUE,5,5,3,5,4

column1:
AETerry,"2012-02-01T14:40:38.48Z","Spartan Warrior Review","

I picked this up through an Internet Reseller with another project in mind for this figure. So taking into account shipping &
column2:
handling, I probably paid a little more than I'd have liked to, but that's the price of trying to get a hold of a specific figure or set once they're out of production and discontinued.

This is just a fantastic minifigure in and of itself. I can see why so many have called it ""The Minifigure"" of Series 2 to get. The minifigure is very well detailed with the printed armor and leggings. The facial print on the head is well done. The color choice involved. It's a great historical representation in LEGO of a Spartan Warrior. The helmet is well molded along with the spear. If I have any complaints it is that the shield seems a bit too small, but it is scaled to Minifigure size all the same and does the job well.

With this figure now out of production, it's too bad it has become too expensive to try and get more of these for an obvious 300 scene or have LEGO do some historical sets for Rome &
column3:
Greek era. That's an area that LEGO hasn't tapped fully for possibilities.
",TRUE,4,3,2,5,4

column1:
ilovelego777,"2011-05-04T09:19:30.597Z","The Spartan Warrior","First, when I heard about series 2 coming, I was excited to get it after all my efforts to get some series 1 minifigures failed. When I saw the picture of 16 minifigures, this was one of the that I should get.

Pros

• Pro 1. Nice Minifigure. First time that Lego made a spartan.
  • Pro 2. It would be great if it was duplicated to make a phalanx of spartans.
  • Pro 3. If you have a lot of these minifigures, you can make them fight the Persians form the Prince of Persia Lego Theme.

  • …
Cons

• Con 1. It is sealed in a polybag.
  • Con 2. It took me three tries to get this one. I got the second one on my last time I bought series 2 which I was sure was the Pharaoh.
  • Con 3. These minifigures easily get sold.
  • Con 4. Rare
  • Con 5. If you really want it without buying so much bags, you must print a cheat sheet of the barcodes or have a barcode app.
  • …

All I can say is that I'm grateful I got two spartans. I'm planning to get some more. My dad finds it nice if I had many of these.

",TRUE,5,5,4,3,4

sideswinger,"2020-07-28T17:10:55.737Z","An EXCELLENT minifigure!","

So the second figure in the LEGO Minifigures Series 2 is the Spartan Warrior, and I do really like this figure. So let'

On top we have that helmet, which is not two pieces, as it may seem. And it is an awesome piece, with the gold moulding and all, and it also has that red top, which I think is printed instead of dual-moulded. It is just a very cool piece, and I'
column2: m not sure if it was new for the figure or not. I would guess it was, but I might be wrong.

column1: Then we have his face, which has a pretty nice print on it. I love the eyebrows, as well as his big black mustache. I also like that angry expression. No alternate face, which is normal for a two dollar figure.
And he has that red cape between his torso and head, and it has no fancy pattern or anything. It is that thick material as well, because the soft felt cape was introduced in 2016, if I'
Then we have his torso, which has some very nice printing. I love his golden breastplate, and it'
column2: s just some very good printing for 2010. And I couldn&#39
column3: t find any good pictures, so my guess is that he has no back torso printing, which is normal for 2010. And if he does have back printing, well that&#39

column1: Then we have is legs, which have some pretty complex printing for back then. The front of his legs
column3: some great ruffle printing, and he has some awesome shoe printing too. But he has side leg printing, which is very neat. There is sort of a gap in the front and side, but the fact that they printed them at all is great. And they put some side shoe printing on him as well, so just some very complex shoe printing.

column1: And then he has two great accessories
column2: the spear, and the shield, both f which were new for the figure. And the spear looks great, with that light gray tip. It is made of rubber too, which is interesting. And then the rest of it is plastic, so it is dual-moulded. Then his shield looks nice, with that stud in the center, but it has no printing, which is sort of sad, but oh well.

column1: And my overall opinion, is that this is an excellent figure. He'
column2: s just very complex for 2010, with the side printing, and the fact that he had three new pieces is awesome. And you get all that for only two bucks. That is amazing and very surprising. And since LEGO has had lots of warrior-like CMF&#39
column3: s, this is one of my favorites, as well as one of the best in the series. The Maraca Man was my favorite, but this guy is extremely close. Definitely second best, if not first-best. Is that a word? I don&#39
column4: t know. But I think that wraps up this review, so thanks for reading!
